snippet: More than 39 strong earthquakes were reported over a three-hour period, officials said, and tremors awakened residents in Rome nearly 100 miles to the southwest of the epicenter....
abstract: Series of strong earthquakes, including one of 6.2 magnitude, strike central Italy, killing at least 10 people, burying victims in rubble and destroying large portions of several towns.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and CHRISTOPHER MELE
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Rome, and Christopher Mele from New York.

lead_paragraph: More than 39 strong earthquakes were reported over a three-hour period, officials said, and tremors awakened residents in Rome nearly 100 miles to the southwest of the epicenter.

headline.main: 6.2-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes Italy, Killing at Least 10
